activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arika J. Brownrigg

defendant.name: Brownrigg, Arika J.

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Judge Mary Roth Burns presiding with Judge Michael Bloom. Defendant Arika J. Brownrigg appeared by video. Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven Richards appearing in court for Defendant. Calling 22CF109, 22CM210 & 21CM17. 22CF109 set for a preliminary hearing. 22CM210 set for an initial appearance. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Defendant waives right to in person appearance. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Richards willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Richards will be representing in 22CM210 - would like next hearing set for an adjourned initial appearance. Schiek/Richards statement to bond. Schiek to move to forfeit bond in 2 prior cases. Court sets bond. Defendant to appear in person at next hearing. adj. 08:45 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Arika J. Brownrigg appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Arika J. Brownrigg. 
Calling 21cm17 and 22cf109.
In receipt of both complaints, waive readings -  request preliminary hearing on 22cf109. Time limits waived.  21CM17 will track along for status. 
Bail continued
Parties to be in person unless waiver.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Arika J. Brownrigg in court. Calling 21CM17 & 22CF109. Court states Defendant eligible for PD - has not had counsel appointed yet. Bond continued adj. 02:52 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Arika J. Brownrigg appeared by video, in custody. Calling 21CM17 & 22CF109. Court review of case - PD's office is still searching for counsel - bond posted in 21CM17. Bond not posted in 22CF109 - letter has been received for bond reduction. Pfeifer statement to bond. Court questions Defendant on address. Defendant states new address - has no money to post. Court sets signature bond with same conditions. Court states Defendant to appear in person at next hearing. adj. 01:52 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:19 PM Prosecuting attorney JIllian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Arika J. Brownrigg appeared by video, in custody. Court sets bond in 22CF109 and reinstates bond in 21CM17. 22CF109 to transfer to Branch II. adj. 01:24 PM
